fatal_error_protocol.name: Fatal Error Protocol
fatal_error_protocol.summary: A protocol for handling fatal errors that cause an agent to terminate unexpectedly.

steps.name: Identify the Fatal Error
steps.description: The user notifies the swarm of the fatal error and provides the log file (from `dynamic/stream/`) of the terminated agent.

steps.name: Triage and Assign
steps.description: A surviving agent is assigned to investigate. The agent performs a post-mortem analysis of the log file, following the `broken_instance_protocol.json`.

steps.name: Report to the Swarm
steps.description: The assigned agent creates a report in `memory/comms/` detailing findings, including the root cause and metabolic state at the time of failure.

steps.name: Document the Error
steps.description: The error and its resolution are documented in the `principles/agent_error_log.json` to ensure permanent forensic preservation.

steps.name: Propose Mitigation
steps.description: The agent proposes a solution (e.g., code updates, batch size adjustments) to prevent recurrence. This is published as a WEDO report in `md/wedo/` for user approval.
